poem:
"Morning Paper, Autumn Light"

Grey headlines spread themselves on morning's table,
Notes on a cold distant war, Putin's fable,
They hum and buzz, silent wasps of ink,
While coffee burns the rim and thoughts, I think.

Pawns on a chessboard, with crowns and horse heads,
Scribbles of conflict, salt on our bread.
War dances with morning, in bitter, sardonic delight,
As we wake, as we read, under Autumn light.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Russia-Ukraine war: Putin warns Nato of risk of nuclear war in major speech to Russian parliament – as it happened 4.10pm GMT We are now closing this blog but you can read all our Ukraine coverage here. 4.00pm GMT Summary It is now approaching 6pm in Kyiv. Here is a summary of the main developments from today: The Russian president, Vladimir Putin, has said the west are attempting to “destroy us” and to “contain our". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
